interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Karate Kid Review Date: 2014/01/24 Store: Jaden Smith (Actor), Jackie Chan (Actor), Harald Zwart (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'When Dre Parker (Jaden Smith) and his mother (Taraji P. Henson) move from Detroit to China, Dre feels lost in a world very different from what he knows. Bullied and beaten up by some fellow students in his school, Dre is rescued by his apartment building’s handyman, Mr. Han (Jackie Chan), a man who is mourning a devastating loss. Mr. Han takes pity on Dre and agrees to teach him kung fu to defend himself. Training together, teacher and student learn to trust each other, and ultimately form a friendship that heals them both.', 'Amazon.com', 'A remake of the 1984 film of the same name,', 'The Karate Kid', "well exceeds expectations, delivering a powerful viewing experience filled with action-packed martial arts scenes, great footage of China and its many wonders, and an absorbing story of a preadolescent boy's struggle to find his own inner strength. The title", 'Karate Kid', "is really a misnomer as it is the art of kung fu that is practiced in this remake, not karate, and other details, including the film's setting in China, also differ from the original film. What remains the same, and just as powerful, is the underlying story: a young boy moves to a new place where he feels isolated and is bullied by his peers. Through an unlikely relationship with an adult, the boy not only learns to protect himself through martial arts, but develops the much more important qualities of respect and the mastery of one's own mind and body. Relative newcomer Jaden Smith (son of actors and producers Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith) is excellent as the main character Drek Parker; Jackie Chan gives a restrained and highly effective performance as his mentor Mr. Han; and Zhenwei Wang is eerily believable as the bully Chen. This is an intense and often violent film that fully engulfs its viewers--be prepared to gasp and cheer out loud, and know that you may never look at the act of putting on and taking off a jacket in the same way again. (Ages 8 and older with parental guidance)", '--Tami Horiuchi'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Martial Arts, Action, Drama, Family, Sports', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, AC-3', 'Contributor': 'Harald Zwart, Jaden Smith, Jackie Chan', 'Language': 'Unqualified, French (Dolby Surround)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 20 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.54 x 5.36 x 7.48 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'CTR35913DVD', 'Director': 'Harald Zwart', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, AC-3', 'Run time': '2 hours and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 5, 2010', 'Actors': 'Jaden Smith, Jackie Chan', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Perhaps the best movie ever.
My grandson and I have watched - 10? times.
The scenery (of China, city and country scenes, Great Wall and monastery fortress) is priceless and extremely well done. Acting superb. Just not a renter - a purchase for sure.
BOth kids now in karate classes, and it has worked wonders. Great! Review Title: A-#1 Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

The user exhibits a strong preference for high-quality movies, particularly those that blend action, drama, and family themes. They appreciate films that feature martial arts and impactful storytelling, especially narratives involving personal growth and relationships. Their enjoyment of "The Karate Kid" highlights a fondness for engaging plots centered on resilience and overcoming adversity, as well as a connection to cultural themes, demonstrated by their appreciation for the film’s Chinese setting.

The user values exceptional cinematography and performances, as indicated by their praise for the film’s visuals and acting. They also display a tendency to invest in purchases that can be repeatedly enjoyed, suggesting a preference for movie ownership over rentals. The mention of watching the movie multiple times with their grandson emphasizes a familial connection to their interests, indicating they enjoy sharing engaging content with loved ones. 

The user's review also showcases a proactive approach to activities related to the film, as evidenced by their grandkids participating in karate classes post-viewing. Overall, they appreciate cinematic experiences that are emotionally resonant, visually captivating, and promote positive values and shared experiences within the family.
